report:
Good evening, Killington,

It was another unreal day here at The Beast, with bright, clear skies setting the stage for buttery turns across the mountain. And we’ve got even more good news on the way. Snow moves in tomorrow afternoon, with flakes picking up after 2 p.m. under breezy east winds and temps topping out around 26 degrees at the summit and 29 degrees at the base. We’re tracking 8 to 12 inches of fresh snow between Friday afternoon and Saturday night. Fresh turns are definitely on the menu!

We're still 100% open and are serving up the most expansive playground in the East. From top-to-bottom groomers to bump lines and hidden tree shots, it’s all in play. Snow surfaces were gripping beautifully again today, letting you link one deep turn after another as the sun and warmer temps kept the slopes soft, smooth, and playful. Groomed trails provide confidence inducing turns and are a blast to lean the edges into. Even as the day goes on, the smooth runs that turn into soft packed and packed powder continue to have a fun surface to rip on. 

Our groomers are after the same program except they’ll be leaving Ovation on natural. Downdraft will see a resurface again and Superstar is still skiing & riding really well. Make your way over to Needle’s Eye on Cruise Control for a classic, cruise worthy run that never disappoints. For our full list of groomers, check out the Lifts & Trails Report. 

Snowmaking operations are still on hold for the time being due to warmer temps, but we could see the snowguns fire up later this week. If you’re curious to learn more about snowmaking and the natural challenges our crew has faced this winter, take a look at our most recent Insider Blog. 

Lifts are scheduled to spin at 9:00 a.m., with the South Ridge Quad and Canyon Quad opening soon after at 10:00 a.m. The Bear Mountain Quad will also spin again, offering full access to Outer Limits and Devil’s Fiddle, amongst other favorites. 

Over in kparks, the lineup stays stacked. Over towards Bear Mountain, Dream Maker is firing with 21 features between the upper and lower sections, and The Stash remains fully in play with its wooden and stone features plus additional natural hits in the woods. On Ramshead, Timberline continues to shine with 45 features, 5 jumps, and a halfpipe, and Easy Street, Lil’ Stash, and Vale Yard are all dialed in for fun progression options.

Tomorrow, February 20th, we'll be hosting 200K Shred Day to celebrate Killington hitting 200,000 followers on Instagram! Join us for our all-day party, first featuring a scavenger hunt for 20 YETI mugs hidden around the mountain. Find one to keep, and you’ll score a 1-day lift ticket voucher, valid through June 1, 2027. We'll also be leading a party lap from the top of Superstar at 2:20 p.m., immediately followed by an après scene at the bottom of Superstar featuring DJ Stevie B and $2.20 Michelob ULTRA, plus complimentary NA beverages and giveaways.

Finally, our Tubing Park presented by bubly remains open daily this week from 10:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. 

Get fired up for a Friday Funday! 

– Evan

report:
How are we Beast Fam? 

A gorgeous bluebird day on the slopes was just what we needed. This weekend has been a blast so far and we’re still firing into Presidents Day. This is winter at Killington in its prime as 100% of our trails are open to shred and we are leading the East in terrain. 

Expect a mostly cloudy day on Washington’s Birthday, with a slight chance of snow showers early tomorrow morning before things settle in. Temps will top out near 30° at the base and 23° near the top, with a steady south wind around 10–15 mph. It’s classic Vermont conditions so get after it.

Despite the beautiful sun beating down on the mountain and perfect temps keeping us happy, the quality of our snow surfaces has not taken a hit at all. Devils Fiddle has been on point and I’ve heard some say it was their run of the year so far. Now that’s some seriously good shredding. You obviously can't go wrong with the terrain at Bear Mountain, and Skyeburst is a great run to cruise on just nearby. All of our lifts will be running tomorrow with key lifts starting to spin at 8:00 a.m. Head over to South Ridge for a sweet morning cruise down Pipe Dream, prime for lapping when the South Ridge Quad starts spinning at 9:00 a.m.

Our grooming team is after it again, covering 96 trials with flush corduroy. They’ll be tackling the same plan minus Outer Limits which will be skiing on natural tomorrow. Groomers are still skiing incredibly well so pick your choice from the Lifts & Trails Report and have a blast carving it up. Some of my favorite picks are Bunny Buster and Double Dipper for those money turns. 

Our snowmaking crews will be lighting up snowguns around the K-1 base area and lower Superstar, with spot guns on the middle of Snowdon. Most of Devils Fiddle will be coming offline besides the bottom section which will get some more attention after temps required a break. The snow can be variable near snowmaking so please take note of that when skiing & riding near those areas. If you are curious to learn more about snowmaking and the natural challenges our crew has faced this winter, take a look at our most recent Insider Blog.  

A quick note related to snowmaking: the whales on Superstar are getting quite large, and skiing & riding on Launch Pad across Superstar is currently for expert skiers and riders only. If you want an easier cruising route, follow our Peak to Creek emblems on our trail signs and stay on Bear Trax. 

Over in kparks, the lineup remains stacked. Dream Maker is firing with 21 features between the upper and lower sections, The Stash remains fully in play with wooden and stone features plus natural hits in the woods, Timberline continues to shine with 45 features, five jumps, and a halfpipe, Easy Street Progression Park has 10 features, and Lil’ Stash is open with three jumps, a tree jump, and a wall ride. In our Vale Yard Park, we're still rocking the Park Affair build from last weekend, featuring 9 features and jumps in total from XS to M difficulty. 

The Tubing Park presented by bubly will open at 10:00 a.m. and will run until 6:00 p.m. this week, offering another great way to keep the fun going off the slopes.

We’re still rolllin’ and I’ll see you out there!

– Evan
